<@UGPPUQWPR>
If you do it this way, you can pull in the some related posts that would automatically be grabbing the current posts topics. Then you wouldn't have to worry about manually entering topics all the time.

You could also take this a step further and create another field with an override toggle (boolean) that you would can then have someone manually populate the `blog_post_override` parameter if there are no related that show so you can then manually place blogs in there.

Hello, using FTP I created a module using the “new directory” process found on this article: <https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/tools/create-and-manage-your-content-with-ftp>. But for some reason the module files, i.e the `fields.json`, `meta.json` are not appearing in my FTP client even though the modules according to the design Manager were correctly creating. Can anyone provide more insight/help on this?
use the refresh folder function in your FTP client
most FTP clients don’t assume they need to refresh after creating a folder, because this behavior is unique to HS
I’ve tried that. And it still reveals an empty directory.
I’ve done that as well. Still no luck.
is there a particular folder within the `design` directory that the modules should be uploaded to? I’ve uploaded them to a new directory. Should they only belong in the root `design` directory?
Yeah it looks like the files will only appear in my Transmit if the “modules” are uploaded/created in the root of the `design` directory. Kind of bummer.

<@U2H3TT8F2> thank you so much for taking the time to respond. I'll give this a shot and see if it makes a difference. I'd have to learn more about the override toggle, but that also sounds like a good solution if this doesn't work – ideally, it would all happen automatically, but I can see a benefit to being able to do it manually as well. Thanks!
No problem, let me know if you need anything else. Always happy to help.
